sentences.en: Continue to carry forward and cultivate the national spirit.
sentences.cn: (二)坚持弘扬和培育民族精神.

sentences.en: Farmers cultivate their farms with cows.
He always tries to cultivate cadres who might be able to help him.
sentences.cn: 他总是试图结识能给予他帮助的干部.

sentences.en: He always tries to cultivate rich and famous people.
sentences.cn: 他总是试图结交有钱有势的人.

sentences.en: I want to enjoy my own faculties as well as to cultivate those of other people.
sentences.cn: 我不但要培养别人的才能,还要享受自己的才能.

sentences.en: If I were a boy abundance time, I will cultivate courage.
sentences.cn: 假如我又回到了童年, 我就要培养勇气.

sentences.en: In their underground nests they cultivate gardens on soil made from finely chopped leaves.
sentences.cn: 在它们的地下巢穴里,它们在精细粉碎的树叶形成的土壤上耕耘菜园.

sentences.en: It is our duty to cultivate the spirit of boldness and fearlessness.
sentences.cn: 我们的责任是培育大无畏的精神.

sentences.en: John always tries to cultivate people who might be able to help him.
sentences.cn: 约翰总是试图结识能给予他帮助的人.

sentences.en: Law 12 Keep others in suspended terror: Cultivate an air of unpredictability.
sentences.cn: 规则12》让他们停留在恐惧中: 营造一种不可预测的气氛.

sentences.en: Really, it took a lot of sense to cultivate and hold such a pose.
sentences.cn: 其实, 要养成和保持这个模样,也需要不少的知识.

sentences.en: The capitalists of our times continued vigorously to cultivate white chauvinism.
sentences.cn: 当代的资本家继续卖力地培养白种沙文主义.

sentences.en: The company has been successful in cultivating a very professional image.
sentences.cn: 公司成功地树立了一个非常专业的形象。

sentences.en: The land was too rocky to cultivate.
sentences.cn: 这块地石头太多，无法耕作。

sentences.en: Then how do we cultivate both blessings and wisdom?
sentences.cn: 那么如何是福慧双修 呢 ?

sentences.en: They moved to the country to cultivate the soil.
Try to cultivate a more relaxed and positive approach to life.
sentences.cn: 要努力养成更为放松和积极的生活态度。

sentences.en: We should cultivate the good habits of diligence and frugality.
sentences.cn: 我们要养成勤俭节约的好风气.

words.tran_cn: 可培养的，可教化的；可耕种的
培养；耕作；耕种；教化；文雅
发展（cultivate的过去分词）；耕作；教化

trans.tran_cn: 耕作，种植，培养（品质等），结交（朋友）
trans.tran_en: to prepare and use land for growing crops and plants

trans.tran_cn: 耕作， 栽培， 养殖； 培养； 陶冶； 发展
trans.tran_en: to work hard to develop a particular skill, attitude, or quality
